notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; two ribbons commencing to the left below the lorymbos, pointing upwards, pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing upwards, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 1 h l.i. mzdysn bgy šhpwhly M[RKAn MRKA] Corrupted legend |mazdēsn bay  Šābuhr šāhān šāh|“The Mazda-worshiping divine Shapur, king of kings"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; on the shaft l'st (rāst,“ just”), to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, three altar plates; above bust with diadem and elaborate coiffure to the left, surrounded by flames depicted by vertical lines; to the left and right of altar attendant with stylized crown of Shapur II, holding a barsom with both hands, both figures facing inwards; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l. i. [š]hpwh[ly] legened illegible; 9h l. o. NWRA [ZY] |ādur ī Šābuhr|“the fire of Shapur” | l'sty on altar shaft| rāst | “rasty”
